intro: Glochidion euryoides, commonly known as the broad-leafed glochidion, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
